alert.note: Alert for Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:18PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Valley, northeastern Gem and southeastern Adams Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 618 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Indian Mountain, or 25 miles south of McCall, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Indian Mountain around 630 PM MDT. Tamarack Ski Area and Cascade Reservoir around 640 PM MDT. Council Mountain and Donnelly around 650 PM MDT. McCall around 700 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains
